ygData.subject: From the diary of a warrior princess
ygData.msgSnippet: Got up this morning camped just outside of the entrance to Guk.  As I was putting my stuff away I was think about the good times I has with my guild mates
ygData.messageBody:
Got up this morning camped just outside of the entrance to Guk. As I was
putting my stuff away I was think about the good times I has with my guild
mates hunting frogs in the dungeon. I had never been to Guk and it was a
lot of fun. Well mostly fun, that one train that wiped out the entire party
was no fun, especially the walk back from the high pass.

So now I was along in the swamps and backing my stuff. Darn backpacks were
heavy and as I put them all one I realized I was encumbered now the �Spirit
of the Bear� had left me (141/130). Time to go sell. Maybe there is a spot
in South Ro I could sell, if not there I knew I could sell at the inn in
Oasis. Oasis would be good. There I could get some experience killing
crocodiles and caimans.

So adjusting my backpacks I started off running around the side of the swamp
to the pass leading to South Ro. An easy trot saw a couple of frogs and an
alligator or two, but nothing that looked worth hunting.

Once I zoned to South Ro I decided to look around a bit to see what was
around. Just a bunch of Orcs, had to kill a couple just because, but didn�t
get any experience. It was also kind of fun to walk straight through the
Orc camps since they were too scared of me to do anything.

�Well enough of this� I thought and turned to go into the desert. Time to
sell my loot and get to killing crocodiles.

As I was crossing the desert I came across a couple of Troll and a dark elf
killing dervishes. Stopped to check things out for a second and to see what
the camp looked like. As I was checking things out I saw a skeleton
standing out in front of the tents all by himself. Well, figured I would
get closer and check him out, might be some good experience for me on the
way to Oasis. Big mistake, wasn�t just any skeleton but a dry bone skeleton
that didn�t like barbarians.

The trolls jumped in to help me, but even with my dual long swords flying
and the trolls beating on the skeleton, I soon found myself laying on my
back again wondering why I ever got so close to the skeleton.

Well soon after that I found myself back in the high hold pass naked except
for my kilt. As I was standing up I got a message from Rallos Zek, the once
I was hoping not to here � �You have failed me once again young barbarian,
no longer can you claim the 16th Rank of warrior, you have lost a level and
are now 15 again.�

Drat and darn, not only did I lose a level, had a long walk ahead of me, but
all my spare stuff from the bank vault was on my body. Oh well, back to the
battle, now I really had to go back to Oasis as soon as possible to make
16th Rank again. Pissing off Rallos Zek is never a good idea.

So I ran as fast as I can, past ghouls, giant spiders, sand giants and orcs.
Finally I was back in the desert of South Ro, hugging the wall, and
looking for my body.

Running south to the dervish tents, I suddenly heard the sound no one wants
to hear. Even the bravest warrior blanches in fear when she hears the
pounding footsteps of a giant behind her.

A sand giant hits you for 96 points
A sand giant hits you for 87 points
You are stunned�

Well that hurt. Once I found myself back in the Pass I decided that was
enough for the day. Looking around I found myself a nice flat rock to rest
on and lay down to camp. Good thing I am a barbarian and the chill air this
high didn�t bother me. Guess I will go get my body later tonight.

For the Honor and Glory of Rallos Zek;

Patty of Halas
username: Patricia
server: Bristlebane
